title: ECB, BOJ seen holding rates as Fed plows ahead: Bank of America Merrill Lynch
text: March 19, 2018 / 1:36 PM / a few seconds ago ECB, BOJ seen holding rates as Fed plows ahead: Bank of America Merrill Lynch Reuters Staff 1 Min Read NEW YORK (Reuters) - The European Central Bank and Bank of Japan are about three years behind the Federal Reserve in policy normalization as inflation in Europe and Japan will likely stay below their 2 percent target in the foreseeable future, Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Monday. FILE PHOTO: The Federal Reserve headquarters in Washington September 16 2015. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque/File Photo The ECB would not raise its policy rates until 2019, while the BOJ would only make modest adjustments in yield curve control and raise its policy rate until at least 2010, Bank of America Merrillâ€™s global economist Ethan Harris wrote in a research note. Reporting by Richard Leong
